name: amanita-chlorinosma
distribution: Throughout NC but chiefly in the Piedmont and Coastal Plain
light: Deep shade (Less than 2 hours to no direct sunlight)
stem-description: The stem is up to 4.5" tall.  The lower 1/3 of the stem narrows until reaching the upper 2/3, remains equal in width.
poison-symptoms: HIGHLY TOXIC MAY BE FATAL IF EATEN! Poisonous through ingestion (Poisonous part: mushroom). Symptoms: Strongly suspected to be toxic; apparently little has been documented on this specific species but it is expected to produce symptoms similar to other Amanita species: nausea, vomiting, dizziness, abdominal pains, etc. Symptoms occur 30 minutes to several hours after ingesting.
